### âœ… Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an "x". All items should be checked before requesting review -->

#### Code Quality
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project (see [CONTRIBUTING.md](../CONTRIBUTING.md))
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have kept my changes focused and minimal

#### Testing
- [ ] I have tested my changes in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- [ ] I have tested responsive behavior on different screen sizes
- [ ] I have verified that all interactive elements work correctly
- [ ] I have tested with keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Escape, etc.)
- [ ] I have checked the browser console for errors

#### Documentation
- [ ] I have updated the documentation (README.md, comments, etc.) where necessary
- [ ] I have updated the folder structure in README if I added/removed files
- [ ] My changes are consistent with existing documentation

#### HCI & Accessibility
- [ ] My changes follow HCI best practices and usability heuristics
- [ ] I have ensured proper color contrast (WCAG standards)
- [ ] I have used semantic HTML elements
- [ ] I have included appropriate ARIA labels where needed
- [ ] My changes are accessible via keyboard navigation

#### Breaking Changes
- [ ] My changes do not break existing functionality
- [ ] If this is a breaking change, I have documented it clearly
- [ ] If this affects existing features, I have updated relevant examples/docs

#### Security
- [ ] I have not introduced any security vulnerabilities
- [ ] User input is properly validated and sanitized
- [ ] No sensitive data is exposed in the code or logs
- [ ] External resources use proper security measures (SRI, HTTPS, etc.)
